alert.note: Alert for Sussex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 2:49AM EST until January 12 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by previous excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey, including the following county, Sussex. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 247 AM EST, flooding continues across portions of the warned area. The river level will continue to fall reaching below flood stage later this morning. - For Pequest River at Huntsville: At 12:45am the stage was 4.04 feet. Flood Stage is 4 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
